metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16860 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in samba's Heimdal KDC implementation, versions 4.8.x up to, excluding 4.8.12, 4.9.x up to, excluding 4.9.8 and 4.10.x up to, excluding 4.10.3, when used in AD DC mode. A man in the middle attacker could use this flaw to intercept the request to the KDC and replace the user name (principal) in the request with any desired user name (principal) that exists in the KDC effectively obtaining a ticket for that principal.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16860` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 1.6~git20131207+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
heimdal-clients-x - 1.6~git20131207+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2+esm1
heimdal-kcm - 1.6~git20131207+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2+esm1

criterions.comment: heimdal package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6~git20131207+dfsg-1ubuntu1.2+esm1').
samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.20+esm1').
